intro: Pteris macilenta, commonly known as the slender water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 20–30 cm in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces small, spore-bearing sori on the underside of its leaves. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
